definition: room/work unit/grave/scabbard/family or clan/one of the 28 constellations of Chinese astronomy

sentences.english: There're many computers in the lesson-preparing office.
sentences.chinese: 在我們備課室裏有許多電腦。

sentences.english: The classroom is a usual place for romantic relationships to develop.
sentences.chinese: 課室通常是發展戀情的一個好場所。

sentences.english: You’re at the window, outside the classroom.
sentences.chinese: 你在窗戶那裏，在課室的外面。

sentences.english: Relocatable sound insulation partitions between classrooms, reducing sound interference between two rooms.
sentences.chinese: 安裝隔音牆於課室之間，減少相互間的聲音干擾。

sentences.english: The students came into the classroom, following their head teacher.
sentences.chinese: 學生們跟着他們的班主任走進課室。

sentences.english: It is necessary for us to clean the classroom every day.
sentences.chinese: 對我們來說每天打掃課室是必要的。

sentences.english: President Bush was visiting a primary school and he visited one of the classes.
sentences.chinese: 布殊總統正在巡視某小學，巡到一個課室。

sentences.english: The local church is the classroom for learning how to get along in God's family.
sentences.chinese: 教會是我們學習在神的家中與人相處的課室。

sentences.english: The staircase collapsed in a classroom being built beside the two tiers .
sentences.chinese: 坍塌的樓梯在一棟正在修建的兩層課室旁邊。

sentences.english: Hirer should take responsible for reinstating the facility to its original condition immediately after use.
sentences.chinese: 團體必須把課室或場地清理至租用前狀況。

sentences.english: Our classroom must be cleaned everyday.
sentences.chinese: 我們的課室必須每天打掃。

definition: to teach/teaching and learning/education/CL:門|门[men2],個|个[ge4]
to go to class/to attend class/to go to teach a class
head of a household/family head/patriarch/parent or guardian of a child
